profiles:
Summary I am a highly motivated manufacturing specialist who has leadership roles in the production of test wafers and engineering silicon starts for Intel's semi-conductor manufacturing clean room facility. 
 
My managers describe me as "extremely capable and motivated." I learn new skills quickly, am able to train co-workers successfully on these skills and manage time and handle multiple tasks without sacrificing safety or quality. I routinely collaborate with manufacturing engineering and support groups to solve problems.  
 
An interest of mine is producing quality product safely in line with Intel's safety culture. I help my team to attain Safety, Quality and Output Goals. I am a member of the Safety and Emergency and Medical Response Teams. 
 
Toolsets: Train and certify Level 1 operators on atmospheric VDF, AWB and RTA tool sets. Also certified on the XR80, E500 and CVD. Experience Manufacturing Specialist Intel Corporation February 2015  – Present (7 months) Hillsboro, Oregon Manufacturing Specialist Intel Corporation March 2006  –  February 2015  (9 years) Hudson, MA Manufacture semiconductor wafers. Perform preventative maintenance and serve as Test Wafer Coordinator. Trained as a Level 2 on the Advanced Wet Bench (AWB) tool set. Started with Intel as a Kelly Services Contractor in 2006; hired direct in 2007.  
•	Sustained proficiency in various area’s / toolsets which provided flexibility to the DRIM team overall and covered all the tactical responsibilities of the ATMO/Starts team.  
•	Designated second shift Wafer Starts Technician for Test Wafers. Work closely with the Engineer to fix Test Wafer Lots.  
•	Applied LEAN boot camp methodologies to improve productivity and coached teammates in LEAN and Safety activities.  
•	Developed learning cards and used 5-WHY Problem Solving methodology. 
•	Collaborated with engineering and other cross functional groups to resolve maintenance issues, improve equipment reliability and unscheduled downtime. 
•	Exceed expectations on safety and commended by managers for making safety a high priority.  
o	Assessed and coached 10-15 peers on proper ergonomic practices.  
o	Key member of a project to conduct safety interviews with factory managers which contributed to establishing a culture of safety throughout Intel.
